title: JSON RPC Timeout not respected via WebSocket
body:
**Description**
Unsure if this is intended or not, but it is problematic when using libraries to perform queries over WS. Querying a large from-to range will be handled by upstream libraries such as go-ethereum over HTTP, but WS will get stuck indefinitely. Consumers may choose to add their own timeout but the current behavior of HTTP vs WS seems inconsistent from one another.

**Steps to Reproduce**
1. If on good hardware, set your timeout to something small, e.g. 5s
2. Run my reproducer with a 100k batch size, first via HTTP and then via WS:
```go
package main

import (
	"context"
	"fmt"
	"log"
	"math/big"

	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum"
	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common"
	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/ethclient"
)

func main() {
	client, err := ethclient.Dial("http://nethermind:8545")
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Failed to connect to the Ethereum client: %v", err)
	}

	contractAddress := common.HexToAddress("0xC3CD9A0aE89Fff83b71b58b6512D43F8a41f363D")
	query := ethereum.FilterQuery{
		FromBlock: big.NewInt(9203578),
		ToBlock:   big.NewInt(9203578 + 100_000),
		Addresses: []common.Address{
			contractAddress,
		},
	}

	logs, err := client.FilterLogs(context.Background(), query)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Failed to filter logs: %v", err)
	}

	fmt.Printf("Number of events: %v\n", len(logs))
}
```

**Actual behavior**
Consumer libraries get stuck when using WS.

**Expected behavior**
Time out JSON RPC queries via WS.
